newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia to raise CPO buffer-stock - Bulog.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia to raise CPO buffer-stock - Bulog.

text.p: Indonesia will raise its crude palm oil buffer stock of 75,000 tonnes following a reduction in export taxes, Beddu Amang, chairman of the National Logistic Bureau (Bulog), said on Wednesday.
"We will have to increase the buffer stock level because of the new export tax," he told Reuters, adding that local prices will become more sensitive to export prices following the tax revision.
Finance Minister Mar'ie Muhammad announced on July 7 that the export tax on crude palm oil would be reduced to five percent and that on palm olein to two percent.
He said that between 1994 and 1996 export taxes on the two items averaged 10-12 percent.
Amang declined to say by how much the buffer-stock level would be raised.
He said Bulog was also studying the local palm olein price level which it considered was reasonable. Previously Bulog had preferred prices to stay below the 1,500 rupiah/kg level.
The reduction in export taxes was part of the government economic deregulation package that reduced import tariffs on 1,600 items aimed at boosting efficiency.
